TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit DispatcherExtensions extends System.Object
public ref class DispatcherExtensions abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides a set of methods that extend the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The methods in this class are defined as extension methods that extend the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher> class. This means that they can be called like an instance method on any <xref:System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher> object.

Docs.summary: Executes the specified delegate asynchronously on the thread that the was created on.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation BeginInvoke (this System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher dispatcher, Action action);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation BeginInvoke(class System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher dispatcher, class System.Action action) cil managed

Docs.param: The dispatcher that executes the delegate.
The delegate to execute, which takes no arguments and does not return a value.
Docs.summary: Executes the specified delegate asynchronously with normal priority on the thread that the specified was created on.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the result of the operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation BeginInvoke (this System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher dispatcher, Action action, System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority priority);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation BeginInvoke(class System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher dispatcher, class System.Action action, valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority priority) cil managed

Docs.param: The dispatcher that executes the delegate.
The delegate to execute, which takes no arguments and does not return a value.
The execution priority of the delegate relative to other pending operations in the event queue.
Docs.summary: Executes the specified delegate asynchronously with the specified priority on the thread that the specified was created on.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the result of the operation.

Docs.summary: Executes the specified delegate synchronously on the thread that the specified was created on.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Invoke (this System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher dispatcher, Action action);
.method public static hidebysig void Invoke(class System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher dispatcher, class System.Action action) cil managed

Docs.param: The dispatcher that executes the delegate.
The delegate to execute, which takes no arguments and does not return a value.
Docs.summary: Executes the specified delegate synchronously with normal priority on the thread that the specified was created on.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Invoke (this System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher dispatcher, Action action, TimeSpan timeout);
.method public static hidebysig void Invoke(class System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher dispatcher, class System.Action action, valuetype System.TimeSpan timeout) cil managed

Docs.param: The dispatcher that executes the delegate.
The delegate to execute, which takes no arguments and does not return a value.
The maximum time to wait for the operation to finish.
Docs.summary: Executes the specified delegate synchronously on the thread that the specified was created on, and stops execution after the specified time-out period.

The execution priority of the delegate relative to other pending operations in the event queue.
Docs.summary: Executes the specified delegate synchronously with the specified priority on the thread that the specified was created on.

The delegate to execute, which takes no arguments and does not return a value.
The maximum time to wait for the operation to finish.
The execution priority of the delegate relative to other pending operations in the event queue.
Docs.summary: Executes the specified delegate synchronously with the specified priority on the thread that the specified was created on, and stops execution after the specified time-out period.
